intro: Gomphandra polymorpha var. oblongifolia, commonly known as the oblong-leafed gomphandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five petals, typically in shades of white or pale pink. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. This variant is noted for its ornamental value and is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
